intro: Taraxacum perdeflexum, commonly known as the bentleaf dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are often curled or folded, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces a single, upright stem that bears a flower head composed of yellow ray florets. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows and grassy areas. Taraxacum perdeflexum is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
